intro: Sparganium multiporcatum, commonly known as the many-toothed burr rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its cylindrical, spike-like inflorescence and is typically found in wetland habitats such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. The plant produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into spiny, seed-bearing burrs. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense stands in suitable moist environments. Sparganium multiporcatum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
